required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Drug-coating Balloon Treatment in Coronary Artery Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Drug-coating Balloon Treatment in Coronary Artery Disease: a Prospective, Multicenter, Registry Study (ULTIMATE-DCB)

lead_sponsor.agency: Nanjing First Hospital, Nanjing Medical University

clinical_study.source: Nanjing First Hospital, Nanjing Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: Drug-coated balloon (DCB) is an alternative choice for patients with coronary artery disease (CAD). This study is to investigate the efficacy and safety of DCB treatment in patients with CAD.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a prospective, multi-center, registry to enroll patients undergoing DCB treatment.
All subjects undergoing DCB treatment will be enrolled in this study without strict inclusion and exclusion criteria. Data and images will be collected during the index procedure, and at the clinical and angiographic follow-up.

primary_outcome.description: TVF is defined as the composite of cardiac death, target-vessel myocardial infarction and ischemia-driven target- vessel revascularization.

secondary_outcome.measure: Parameter by quantitative coronary angiography at 7 months

secondary_outcome.description: Bailout DES implantation rate during procedure by angiographic criteria

arm_group.description: DCB (Sequent® Please) treatment will be performed for suitable patients with CAD.

intervention.description: DCB (Sequent® Please) treatment for CAD patients will be enrolled. Intravascular ultrasound (Boston Scientific®) guidance is recommended.

study_pop.textblock: All subjects with coronary artery disease undergoing DCB treatment will be enrolled in this study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients suitable for DCB treatment
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy
- Contraindications to contrast media, antiplatelet therapy, or paclitaxel
- Expected life less than 12 months
- Cardiac shock

overall_official.affiliation: Nanjing First Hospital, Nanjing Medical University

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Nanjing First Hospital, Nanjing Medical University
responsible_party.investigator_title: Vice chief of the department of cardiology
